Contract Award Notice: 
**Advanced Contract Award for Analysis of Mercury in Precipitation and Ammonia in Air**
 
**Contract Title (English/French):** 
Advance Contract Award Notice – Analysis of mercury in precipitation and ammonia in air at select Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network monitoring sites / Préavis d’adjudication de contrat — Analyse du mercure dans les précipitations et de l’ammoniac dans l’air à certains sites de surveillance du Réseau canadien d’échantillonnage des précipitations et de l’air
 
**Contract Reference and Number:**
PW-23-01029811 / numéro de référence : PW-23-01029811
 
**Contract Award Date and Notice Publish Date:**
Publication date: 2023-03-10 / Date de publication: 2023-03-10
 
**Contract Scope and Objective:**
The Government of Canada intends to enter into a contract with the University of Wisconsin for the analysis of mercury in precipitation and ammonia in air at select Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network (CAPMoN) monitoring sites. 

**Contract Description:**
This contract aims to ensure the collection and analysis of mercury precipitation and ammonia air samples at Canadian sites, as part of the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network (CAPMoN) and the National Atmospheric Deposition Program (NADP). 

**Requirements:**
The contractor shall provide sampling media, manage supplies, implement quality control and assurance measures, support instrumentation and training, and provide data in an electronic format.

**Contract Period:**
Initial Period: Contract award to March 31, 2024 / Première période : Attribution du contrat au 31 mars 2024

Option Period: To be negotiated, with a total estimated value of up to 323,200,00 $.

**Cost Estimate:**
Initial Period: Approximately 77,500,00$ / taxes applicable.

Option Period: Up to an additional 220,700,00$ / taxes applicable, depending on the number of additional sites.

**Notice Invitation:**
This notice invites suppliers to submit an “Expression of Interest” or statement of capabilities by March 24, 2023 at 3:00 p.m Eastern Daylight Time.

Please address all inquiries and statements of capabilities to: Shawn Davis, Procurement and Contracting, Environment and Climate Change Canada.
